movies.title: Meetings with Remarkable Men
movies.plot: The story of G.I. Gurdjieff and his travels to achieve enlightenment and inner growth. Beginning with his childhood, the movie follows his journeys through Central Asia as he discovers new levels of spirituality through music, dance and near-encounters with death.
movies.simplePlot: is a spiritual teacher and mystic who, after a lifetime study, developed a form of meditation incorporating modern dance.

biography.bio: Dragan Maksimovic was born on February 7, 1949 in Podujevo, Serbia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for Joli village, jolie flamme (1996), Meetings with Remarkable Men (1979) and Usijanje (1979). He died on February 4, 2001 in Belgrade, Serbia, Federal Republic of Yugoslavia.
biography.name: Dragan Maksimovic

biography.bio: Terence Henry Stamp was born and lived in Canal Road, Bow, until German bombers forced his family to move to Plaistow. An icon of the 1960s, he dated the likes of Julie Christie, Brigitte Bardot and Jean Shrimpton. After an extremely successful early career, starring in Modesty Blaise (1966), Poor Cow (1967) and Far from the Madding Crowd (1967), Stamp withdrew from mainstream films after his girlfriend, supermodel Jean Shrimpton, left him, and he and went on a 10-year sabbatical in India. He returned home in the late 1970s to star as the evil General Zod in Superman II (1980), and in 1984, delivered what many consider his finest performance as the supergrass in Stephen Frears' The Hit (1984). A few minor but colourful roles, topped by his performance as the transsexual Bernadette in Priscilla, folle du désert (1994), have put Stamp back in the British consciousness. His role of a vengeful gangster in The Limey (1999) was created especially for him by its director.
biography.name: Terence Stamp

biography.bio: Mikica Dimitrijevic is an actor, known for Meetings with Remarkable Men (1979).
biography.name: Mikica Dimitrijevic

biography.bio: Athol Fugard was born on June 11, 1932 in Middleburg, Cape Province, South Africa. He is a writer and actor, known for Tsotsi (2005), Gandhi (1982) and Boesman & Lena (2000).
biography.name: Athol Fugard

biography.bio: Warren Mitchell was born on January 14, 1926 in Stoke Newington, London, England as Warren Misell. He was an actor, known for Till Death Us Do Part (1965), In Sickness and in Health (1985) and Help! (1965). He was married to Constance Wake. He died on November 14, 2015 in Highgate, London.
biography.name: Warren Mitchell

biography.bio: Fahro Konjhodzic was born on January 13, 1931 in Sarajevo, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Yugoslavia. He was an actor, known for The Marathon Family (1982), Meetings with Remarkable Men (1979) and Gazija (1981). He died on May 26, 1984 in Zagreb, Croatia, Yugoslavia.
biography.name: Fahro Konjhodzic

biography.bio: David Markham was born on April 3, 1913 in Wick, Worcestershire, England as Peter Basil Harrison. He was an actor, known for Gandhi (1982), Day for Night (1973) and Tess (1979). He was married to Olive Dehn. He died on December 15, 1983 in Coleman's Hatch, East Sussex, England.
biography.name: David Markham

biography.bio: Natasha Parry was born on December 2, 1930 in London, England as Natalie Wills. She was an actress, known for Romeo and Juliet (1968), Midnight Lace (1960) and Windom's Way (1957). She was married to Peter Brook. She died on July 22, 2015 in La Baule-Escoublac, Loire-Atlantique, France.
biography.name: Natasha Parry

biography.bio: Bruce Myers is an actor, known for The Unbearable Lightness of Being (1988), Henry & June (1990) and Le petit lieutenant (2005).
biography.name: Bruce Myers

biography.placeOfBirth: Bangor, County Down, Northern Ireland, UK
biography.bio: Colin Blakely was born on September 23, 1930 in Bangor, County Down, Northern Ireland as Colin George Blakely. He is known for his work on The Pink Panther Strikes Again (1976), Evil Under the Sun (1982) and The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes (1970). He was married to Margaret Whiting. He died on May 7, 1987 in London, England.
biography.name: Colin Blakely

biography.bio: Grégoire Aslan was born on March 28, 1908 in Constantinople, Ottoman Empire as Krikor Aslanian. He was an actor and writer, known for Cleopatra (1963), The Return of the Pink Panther (1975) and Paris When It Sizzles (1964). He was married to Denise Noël and Jacqueline Dumonceau. He died on January 8, 1982 in Breage, Cornwall, England.
biography.name: Grégoire Aslan

biography.bio: Tom Fleming was born on June 29, 1927 in Edinburgh, Scotland as Thomas Kelman Fleming. He was an actor, known for Mary, Queen of Scots (1971), King Lear (1971) and Spindrift (1959). He died on April 18, 2010 in Edinburgh.
biography.name: Tom Fleming

biography.bio: The character actor Andrew Keir (originally Andrew Buggy) was born in 1926 in the coal-mining town of Shotts in Lanarkshire, Scotland, and raised there with his five brothers John, Tom, Michael, Patrick, and Hugh and his sister Maggie. The son of a coal miner, Keir worked in the coal mines from age 14 to 20, at which point he joined the Glasgow Citizen's Theatre to train as an actor. Shortly thereafter, Keir established himself professionally in British theater, television, and film, debuting in The Lady Craved Excitement (1950). His bluff, no-nonsense demeanor was perfect for authoritarian and military roles, especially Roman soldiers, as in Cleopatra (1963), The Fall of the Roman Empire (1964), and The Viking Queen (1967). He hooked up with Hammer Productions early on (his debut film) and continued the association in a number of horror films, e.g., Dracula: Prince of Darkness (1966) and Blood from the Mummy's Tomb (1971). One of his best-known and most popular performances was that of the title role in Five Million Years to Earth (1967). Keir made numerous appearances in television throughout his career, notably in Adam Smith (1972) and in the Australian series The Outsiders (1976). Keir, true to his heritage, frequently played Scotsmen, especially in the latter part of his career.
biography.name: Andrew Keir

biography.bio: Sami Tahasuni is an actor, known for Meetings with Remarkable Men (1979), Stranger and the Fog (1976) and Ballad of Tara (1979).
biography.name: Sami Tahasuni

biography.bio: Fabijan Sovagovic was born on January 4, 1932 in Ladimirevci, Croatia, Yugoslavia. He was an actor and writer, known for Handcuffs (1970), Rhythm of a Crime (1981) and The House (1975). He was married to Maja Blaskov-Sovagovic. He died on January 1, 2001 in Zagreb, Croatia.
biography.name: Fabijan Sovagovic
